fbcf2032-184c-49b8-bc02-fdb349d7cba6.description: Earners of the Experiential Network badge successfully completed a sponsored professional project for a real-world organization. This is a level 1 badge.

Executed the project according to plan

Presented complete project deliverable solution to sponsor in order to satisfy scoped business needs.

1fcf7222-6939-49fa-8be1-ce63f5a5fee2.description: Demonstrates learners' recognition of applied project risk management work, knowledge of positive and negative risk events, and benefits of risk mitigation techniques. This is a level 3 badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Completed PJM 6135 Quality Analytics with a final grade of B or better.

e70cd406-d0dd-4690-8705-a130f5941804.description: Earners of the Bloomberg Certification badge have completed the required modules in the Bloomberg Market Concepts (BMC) e-learning course. badge_template_activities.title: Completed the required BMC modules throughout the semester.

636e01f8-223a-4dec-802f-f6a6d18f6078.description: Earners of this Level 3 badge successfully completed an intensive 6-week graduate level course taught by Northeastern University faculty. Participants gained the knowledge and skills required to conduct effective negotiations and mediations and practiced the application of those skills in realistic simulations.
636e01f8-223a-4dec-802f-f6a6d18f6078.name: Negotiation Fundamentals

Identified and addressed the ethical issues that can emerge during the negotiation process

ee7371b0-3d24-4949-8470-640692cd8af3.description: Earners surveyed analytics concepts & practices across a range of industries & contexts. They engaged with current theories, practices, & debates in the field of analytics to critically examine its practice. Distinctions among specific analytical techniques & tools, including the use of Excel for fundamental methods were explored. Level 3 badge
ee7371b0-3d24-4949-8470-640692cd8af3.name: Introduction to Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Applied basic probability concepts

Utilized "R" as a toolset for processing and analyzing basic data

Visualized data in a compelling way to enable data-driven storytelling
Described the major steps of an analytics project, the various job functions, and who performs them with a focus on identifying where they want to participate in the data analytics ecosystem

b9449936-6c37-4d37-9ea3-06f2e390b4df.description: Participants of the Graduate Leadership Institute (GLI) attended a series of 9 theory-based, interactive, leadership development sessions. The GLI participants completed the program with a group presentation about a specific leadership competency. This is a Level 2 badge.
b9449936-6c37-4d37-9ea3-06f2e390b4df.name: Graduate Leadership Institute

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated understanding for leadership development theory and learning domains through a group presentation on a specific leadership competency
Gained insights through the CliftonStrengths assessment to adapt to a myriad of challenges faced by leaders in their professional fields utilizing their natural strengths
Connected social justice activities with leadership development
Provided and accepted constructive feedback to and from peers

efdad0e8-d0d0-4101-a87e-c5002b5d9b4f.description: Recipients of the Global and Intercultural Communication Badge synthesized theories of global citizenship and cultural difference. Through an interactive, group project, they demonstrated tolerance for uncertainty, openness to considering multiple perspectives, cultural humility, and ability to work in diverse teams.
efdad0e8-d0d0-4101-a87e-c5002b5d9b4f.name: Global and Intercultural Communication

Assembled a global and intercultural learning lexicon by identifying and understood various definitions, origins, and critiques of the ideas of global citizenship, globalization, cosmopolitanism, pluralism, and cultural difference.
Completed a global and intercultural communication competency assessment.

95238e2e-6c2d-421e-972d-b4105a6fa7d5.description: Earners of this Level 3 badge have learned how to successfully build and lead highly effective teams. They have gained a clear understanding of the relationship between fundamental leadership principles and group dynamics. Last, they applied their leadership skills in the context of an experiential learning project that effectively required managing different personalities, cultures, and varying individual skill levels.
95238e2e-6c2d-421e-972d-b4105a6fa7d5.name: Global Strategic Management

badge_template_activities.title: Defined the key characteristics of an effective team. Examined the stages of team development. Identified the critical role of the team leader in the overall success of a team. Explored the factors that determine high performance teams. Reviewed the factors that influence the success of virtual teams. Applied the knowledge to a project that supports an external organization. Identified team leadership effectiveness by diagnosing team needs, defining an action plan, and soliciting feedback .
Students work on an experiential learning project that requires a consulting report and formal presentation to the project sponsor.

29a76740-8a79-4fe4-8aba-6d33546ffb4d.description: Recipients of this Level 3 badge improved their professional consulting skills by addressing a problem of practice for the United States Department of State. Students researched and analyzed a specific area of interest as requested by a U.S Embassy. They produced recommendations and presented solutions contributing to the formulation of U.S. foreign policy.

Submitted revised and edited one or more of the following products: policy memo with data and supporting research in appendices, research paper, statistical analyses, data sets, or video production

851cc693-4229-4c43-a405-3a594a0e3465.description: Earners evaluated and applied key informational design concepts, with an emphasis on the relationship between information and audience in the context of communicating complex quantitative information. They discussed ethical questions related to the communication and visualization of data analytics. This is a level 3 badge.
851cc693-4229-4c43-a405-3a594a0e3465.name: Data Visualization and Storytelling Basics

Applied strategies for systematic visual exploration of multidimensional and heterogeneous data sets using XY plots, histograms, bar charts, etc.
Evaluated, proposed, and implemented appropriate visualizations for a specified audience using key informational design concepts
Analyzed the ethical considerations and diverse perspectives within an organization to communicate relevant and accurate data

91c09e51-eef2-44cd-9708-67c72120ffbc.description: Earners have demonstrated core career readiness competencies that prepare them for success in the workplace and lifelong career journeys. They demonstrated skills in cover letter and resume writing, networking, interviewing, negotiation tactics, and self-marketing with confidence, while presenting themselves as viable candidates to potential employers and other industry-specific connections.
91c09e51-eef2-44cd-9708-67c72120ffbc.name: Career Management

badge_template_activities.title: Complete assignments and discussion boards pertaining to the course topics provided in the self-paced outline.

fa7c6e7d-29a1-4ad5-ab53-c7dd78124c25.description: Magnet for Global Innovation for Ericsson badge incorporates the applications of strategic thinking and change leadership. Participants have equipped themselves with skills to approach the new era of digitization technology within Ericsson's strategy.
fa7c6e7d-29a1-4ad5-ab53-c7dd78124c25.name: Ericsson Magnet for Global Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: Earners participated in the Ericsson Magnet for Global Innovation Program.
Earners designed a presentation for the program.

63bfd960-c64d-437a-9a0f-7d59f619403d.description: Earners of the Value Creation Innovation for Impact Practitioner badge can apply the Carlson-Polizzotto Value Creation Methodology to innovative ideas. The method considers customer’s needs, approach, benefits per cost, and competition as related to business unit projects. Learners know that multiple iterations of ideas and feedback lead to improvements. They identify elements of risk reduction and create and present a business plan.
63bfd960-c64d-437a-9a0f-7d59f619403d.name: Ericsson Magnet for Global Innovation - Value Creation Innovation for Impact: Practitioner

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in seven weekly meetings to refine, iterate and receive feedback on project ideas as the concepts of value creation were applied. Sessions involved peers, mentors and faculty.
Mentors and managers collaborated through feedback meetings to expand networking and visibility of the projects.

The weekly meetings provided an understanding of the value of iteration as well as giving and receiving feedback to hone ideas for a more solid outcome. The process can be carried into all aspects of future ideation.
A business case deliverable with executive summary is produced.
Business case culminates in a presentation to executives.

c5c1e29a-fe04-47e6-955a-6bbabd2aee76.description: Recipients of the Explorations in Project Management badge participated in a multi-session workshop facilitated by Northeastern faculty. Through discussion and class activities participants explored critical PM concepts including: project life-cycle frameworks, project initiation, project planning, project execution, monitoring, control and closing. Earners were also exposed to team leadership techniques to address build and lead high performing project teams. This is a Level 2 badge.
c5c1e29a-fe04-47e6-955a-6bbabd2aee76.name: Explorations in Project Management

badge_template_activities.title: Analyzed strategies and identified best practices for project management.
Practiced creating project management artifacts such as team charters, stakeholder analysis, project charter and scope statement, work breakdown structure, risk register.
Explored the role of leadership in team activity.

2b2f7d59-1890-4524-8fec-b00f096d5883.description: Recipients of HR Metrics Badge demonstrated their workforce analytics skills through examining metrics and approaches to measure engagement, diversity, performance and learning management. They employed a variety of analytics tools and methodologies pertaining to employee health, wellness, welfare, and work-life programs to support human resource initiatives. Analyze issues of risk and ethics as they propose effective human resources initiatives based on workforce analytics.
2b2f7d59-1890-4524-8fec-b00f096d5883.name: Human Resources Metrics

badge_template_activities.title: Examine fundamental principles of quantitative analysis and their application to the use of HR metrics. Examined a critical thinking path and decision-based framework used to support HR initiative recommendations, incorporating the necessary factors for planning, analysis, selecting metrics, and collecting data. Incorporated workforce analytics into recruitment and selection, employee turnover, and absenteeism initiatives.

Examined metrics and approaches to measure engagement, diversity, performance and learning management Employed a variety of analytics tools and methodologies pertaining to employee health, wellness, welfare, and work-life programs to support human resource initiatives Formulated recommendations for HR programs based on analytical findings and insight. Presented initiatives and perspectives in both a professional and persuasive manner to the intended audience.

Analyzed issues of risk and ethics in the use of workforce analytics. Proposed effective human resources initiatives based on workforce analytics. Created a data collection and analysis plan given a business scenario in the field of HR.

1b94bf0e-fe30-43f1-a16a-33c5ac919b9c.description: Earners of the Crisis Communication Skills badge successfully completed an intensive 6-week course. They practiced those skills through examination of contemporary organizations in crisis and application in realistic scenarios. This is a Level 3 badge.
1b94bf0e-fe30-43f1-a16a-33c5ac919b9c.name: Crisis Communication

Examined the importance of advance preparation when it comes to stakeholder relationships, communication channels, key messages, and crisis spokesperson.
Applied crisis communication practices as decision-maker in a real-life scenario.

45687d6e-a0be-487b-bec0-8d5ab791eea3.description: Earners of this Level 3 badge successfully completed an intensive 6-week course. badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated an understanding of the communication assessment methodology
Interpreted digital metrics as indicators of behavioral responses to communication
Based on measurement results, developed recommendations for improving communication activities
Conducted benchmarking research
Conducted a stakeholder analysis
Evaluated and designed a range of measurement tools, including heuristic assessment and survey questions
Developed key performance indicators for outputs, attitudes, and behaviors

afb477cc-2427-4610-ab03-c8b36f52db34.name: Leading with C.A.R.E.

Completed a 3-page reflection paper articulating personal leadership strengths and how to leverage these effectively to lead others with confidence.

They developed an understanding of the challenges and limitations of AI related to healthcare, and became familiar with foundational algorithms used to advance today’s autonomous robots. Badge earners also learned how Northeastern community members are leveraging the power of AI.

badge_template_activities.title: Evaluated appropriate uses of AI in healthcare

Demonstrated a knowledge of mobile robotics terminology
Established an understanding of functional blocks for autonomous robots
Showed an understanding of path planning algorithms for autonomous robots
Discovered new AI initiatives and research taking place at Northeastern

7595d7d2-1701-4869-a4e1-9df1b779ff3d.name: Communication Planning

Relationship-building – collaborated effectively with team members and with project sponsors.

3fb8f680-124a-4672-bb34-6dd01ddef287.description: Recipients of the Introduction to Machine Learning: Reshaping Product Design badge completed learning experiences in machine learning [ML] concepts and practiced applying them to product design cycle management. 3fb8f680-124a-4672-bb34-6dd01ddef287.name: Introduction to Machine Learning

23e49c47-e009-4e5d-8e76-02f8bbb96187.name: Cultural Audit

badge_template_activities.title: Designed cultural audit that draws on the intersection of stakeholders, key historical elements, politics and linguistics at the organizational and societal levels. Integrated and applied communication concepts, research skills, information literacy, interdisciplinary focus and strategic methodologies to interpret sources. Formulated an evaluation that can promote the strategic aspirations of an organization or ecosystem based on the cultural audit.
The Cultural Audit presentation

50749eb8-3923-43d2-a27d-8c3224998e30.description: Earners of this Level 3 badge successfully completed an intensive 6-week graduate level course taught by Northeastern University faculty. 50749eb8-3923-43d2-a27d-8c3224998e30.name: Meeting Management

Developed facilitation guides, which incorporate facilitation best practices and apply to several different meeting purposes and scenarios

2b9798e5-4b5c-46f5-a117-dab92ffa6bf7.description: In the Lifelong Learning: On-Demand, Recognizing and Mitigating Trauma for Personal Holistic Well-being and Professional Practice, earners were introduced to developing practices and skills to mitigate their own cumulative stress and trauma, with skills to build resilience sustainably. Gained metacognitive insight into their own triggers, coping mechanisms, their potential origins, which can inform them how best to strategically channel their self-awareness into empathy. This is a level 1 badge.
2b9798e5-4b5c-46f5-a117-dab92ffa6bf7.name: Self-care and Wellness

badge_template_activities.title: Examined their own trauma experiences (Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs), personal, cumulative, and vicarious) and consider how these influence their personal and professional efficacy (triggers and response)
Identified both adaptive and maladaptive responses, and analyzed effective versus less effective response patterns on this continuum, focusing awareness on their own patterns
Considered effective and holistic coping strategies, and created a personal plan to implement responsive, adaptive strategies for personal and professional practice

9c28477a-9eac-4faa-bf5a-d1fd3ac23a7e.description: Earners of the Experiential Team Challenge badge successfully conducted research and developed recommendations for a project sponsored by a real-world organization. 9c28477a-9eac-4faa-bf5a-d1fd3ac23a7e.name: Experiential Team Challenge

badge_template_activities.title: Worked collaboratively to conduct research and develop recommendations over a four-week time frame

80d883f7-aaac-41d7-a1d1-a5cd9d52116d.name: Leadership Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Described aspects of an effective leadership communications strategy, including purpose, messages, media/forum and audiences and how theory guides practice. Analyzed audiences, tapping on cultural and emotional intelligence, and evaluated channel options and designed communication strategies tailored to them. Implemented and applied course concepts to plan and deliver presentations of authentic leadership messaging confidently and persuasively.
The students prepare a TEDx type video of their presentation

537f4a0e-3399-4d76-987e-393442ae22c2.description: Recipients of the Global Strategic Planning badge have demonstrated improved analytical, leadership, communication skills by running a fictious drone-manufacturing company and competing with their classmates. They prepared individual reports and group presentations to assess their company's strategic, financial, marketing, and CSR strategies. This is a Level 3 badge.
537f4a0e-3399-4d76-987e-393442ae22c2.name: Global Strategic Planning

badge_template_activities.title: Collaborate with teammates/co-managers in the Glo-Bus simulation to apply marketing, HR, and financial strategies and strengthen their company’s competitive position in the global marketplace.
Communicate concisely and persuasively both orally and in writing (as tested via peer assessment and in the Glo-bus assignments).
Apply competitor analysis models to predict the competitive moves of rivals and segment an industry into its markets to assess the relative attractiveness of different segments.
Earn at least a B on the Glo-Bus Business Simulation + Glo-bus Individual paper (40% of the final grade for MGT 4850: Business Strategy).

9d363aff-efd9-4909-b220-43f6c4edd435.description: Recipients of this badge gained a head start on the theory, statistics, and technology used in data analytics. Students interacted with like-minded colleagues across multiple companies and industries to connect and collaborate. This is a Level 2 badge.
9d363aff-efd9-4909-b220-43f6c4edd435.name: Explorations in Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Asked meaningful questions of data
Effectively communicated analytic results
Developed strategies for ensuring analytics project success

389fcb45-cd63-4efb-bffa-df762b2e7e4c.description: Earners of the Biotechnology and Drug Development badge participated in a lecture series that consists of 12-14 synchronous one-hour lectures. They received an overview of the biotechnology industry through the full lifecycle of drug development. Participants learned through case studies and multiple case examples. They gained knowledge about the details of drug development processes and outcomes and applied this knowledge to reflect on their career path. This is a Level 1 badge.
389fcb45-cd63-4efb-bffa-df762b2e7e4c.name: Biotechnology and Drug Development

Understood the development of innovative technologies for overcoming challenges in drug delivery and continuing safety monitoring
Learned about the underlying regulatory, technological, and business factors driving digital transformation in biopharmaceutical operations

17768d35-04b4-422e-9a8d-03922bd55999.description: Earners of the CASE Institute badge have incorporated and applied key case interviewing foundations into their practice, enabling them to evaluate and apply appropriate case interview frameworks. Having received feedback on their performance from casing instructors, they’re prepared for future case interviews. They’re experienced in case interview communication and presentation.
17768d35-04b4-422e-9a8d-03922bd55999.name: CASE Institute - Case Interview Prep Course

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 6-week CASE interview course with four lessons on profitability, market entry, M&A, and market sizing by an experienced instructor.

Presented and recorded a mid-round case with a partner for feedback.
Prepared and executed an individual case for professional feedback and final evaluation.

1a30751d-aeb9-4b32-b83f-a4fb74c07884.description: Recipients of the Teaching with Academic Technology Badge successfully completed a comprehensive training program in academic technology and digital pedagogy by creating an online-ready course in Canvas, developing a digital portfolio of work, and communicating pedagogical strategies to a network of colleagues.
1a30751d-aeb9-4b32-b83f-a4fb74c07884.name: Teaching with Academic Technology - Level 2

Showcased and presented work digitally through Digital Pedagogy Portfolio platform

Demonstrated preparedness to support faculty’s use of Canvas to design deep, engaged learning experiences

Earners can translate financial outcomes to plan for success in the role of integrated budgets and can build a business case with an action plan to drive results.

They demonstrated hands-on proficiency in pipetting, using pH meter and balance, proper gowning, and clean room behavior. They were introduced to cell culture procedures and learned aseptic technique through the thaw, monitor, subculture and freeze of human fibroblasts and CHO cells. This is a level 1 badge.

Demonstrated proper clean room protocol behavior, including gowning procedure, environmental control, particle counting, clean room classification, HEPA filtration, pressure differentials, and airlocks.
Demonstrated proper aseptic technique while working in a biosafety cabinet, including understanding of laminar flow, surface decontamination, organization of working place, and sterile handling.

Described the biomanufacturing workflow, including Upstream procedures from thaw to harvest, understanding differences between stainless steel and single-use bioreactors, Downstream procedures (types of chromatography, filtration, viral clearance), and formulation/fill finish of drug product.

f4bef9d0-a3c9-41d8-a2cc-f4c750fc8db4.description: Participants in this 3-week workshop took steps to develop/refine their analytical thinking skills. Analyzed collections of statements to improve their understanding of argumentation and of the nature of validity versus invalidity. They learned various formal rules of reasoning and applied them to assess the strength/effectiveness of arguments. Identified examples of arguments in reports and other media, applying some formal rules learned to assess those arguments. This is a level 2 badge.
f4bef9d0-a3c9-41d8-a2cc-f4c750fc8db4.name: Thinking Analytically with Data

badge_template_activities.title: Identified patterns in argumentative statements
Reflected on current analytical thinking skills and their application to personal and professional work
Translated arguments in propositional forms, including premise and conclusion
Identified arguments as valid or invalid with justification
Critically analyzed arguments in work or in the media (satisfactory marked)
